form.name: form1

div.span: overnor Mike DeWine has extended the short-term school closure until May 1, 2020. As a result, Warrensville Heights City School District and all district sponsored activities and athletics are also canceled through May 1, 2020.
With a longer-duration closure now in effect until May 1, we are modifying our distance
program to ensure that it will be sustainable for our students, staff and families, and responsive to whatever lies ahead.

UPDATE AS OF APRIL 7, 2020
Governor Mike DeWine has extended his school closure order. As a result, Warrensville Heights City School District will be closed through Friday, May 1, 2020 due to the coronavirus.
During this time, there will be NO District sponsored athletics or activities. With a longer-duration closure now in effect until at least May 1, we are modifying our distance learning program to ensure that it will be sustainable for our students, staff, and families, and that it will be responsive to whatever lies ahead. Our Mobile Meal program will continue with delivery days on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays.
All activities/assignments assigned prior to April 6, 2020, will not be graded or counted as completed. However, beginning April 6th, teachers will keep track of the activities/assignments that students complete. Students are REQUIRED to complete activities/assignments. More information will be forthcoming as to how grading will look during this time.
We will get through this together—One Team, One Vision, One Goal.

span.p: Chromebook Repair & Troubleshooting for ALL District Scholars on Friday, April 17th from 9am-Noon at Warrensville Heights High School.

br.span: The April 15, 2020 School Board Meeting will be live streamed on our DIstrict YouTube page.
The WHMS distance learning website is live for student use. Please visit daily for important updates.

img.alt: FREE Hot Meals for Scholars at Fredericks in Warrensville

td.a: FREE Hot Meals for Scholars at Fredericks in Warrensville

br.span: Beginning this Tuesday, scholars under the age of 19 can visit Fredericks in Warrensville for FREE hot meals from 11am to 6pm.

a.title: Location: 22005 Emery Rd, Warrensville Heights, OH 44128 Starting at: 11:00 AM Ending at: 6:00 PM

div.div: Creating an education environment that promotes CURIOSITY, CRITICAL THINKING, COMMUNICATION and COLLABORATION while empowering scholars to be responsible contributing members of our community, nation and world.
